meanings.definition: The quality or state of being traceable.
meanings.sent1: The traceabilities of the missing package helped locate it quickly.
meanings.sent2: The company's strict procedures ensure the traceabilities of all products.
meanings.sent3: The detective's superpower was his incredible traceabilities in solving mysteries.
meanings.sent4: In the digital age, privacy concerns challenge the traceabilities of online activities.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's research uncovered the hidden traceabilities of ancient artifacts.

meanings.definition: The ability to trace or track something.
meanings.sent1: The traceabilities of the scent led the dog to the lost child.
meanings.sent2: Modern technology has greatly enhanced our traceabilities of wildlife movements.
meanings.sent3: The spy's impressive traceabilities allowed him to follow the suspect undetected.
meanings.sent4: The map provided clear traceabilities of the hiking trail through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The detective relied on his keen traceabilities to solve the complex case.
